title: Home voting: Over 12,000 elderly and disabled voters cast votes for Rajasthan assembly polls
article: Over 12,000 elderly and disabled voters in Jaipur, Rajasthan have cast their votes in the first phase of home voting for the assembly elections. These voters, who are aged above 80 or have disabilities, are eligible to vote from their homes. The Election Commission has sent special polling teams to record their votes in postal ballots in complete secrecy. A total of 62,927 voters in the state have applied for home voting. Voting will continue through postal ballots until November 19.

title: ‘Open more special care centres for disabled kids’
Parents worried as CBSE rejects disability assessment certificates
Gadkari announces special hospital for senior citizens
Duare Sarkar footfall crosses 10-crore mark
article: Bengal’s flagship programme Duare Sarkar has recorded a footfall of over 10 crore since its launch on December 1, 2020. At present, the seventh edition is underway. Since September 1, when the seventh edition started, till Wednesday, the camps have recorded 65 lakh footfall. This time, Duare Daktar camps are also being held simultaneously to provide healthcare along with disability certificates. Duare Sarkar camps will be held till September 16.

title: Disabled man, 25, burnt alive over dispute, claim kin
article: A 25-year-old disabled man was allegedly burnt alive over a land dispute in Gorakhpur in the wee hours of Monday. The victim, Surendra Yadav (25), was sleeping outside his house when his cot caught fire under mysterious circumstances.

title: Mys gets separate enclosure for dogs with disabilities in Bogadi
Para-badminton player crowdfunds her way to bronze at international meet in Indonesia
article: Prema Biswas, a para-badminton player from Uttarakhand, won a bronze medal at the Fox Indonesia Para-badminton International tournament in Kuala Lumpur. Prema, who has 100% disability in her legs, faced financial struggles in arranging funds for the tournament but received help through a crowdfunding campaign.

title: Many avail of services at camps for people with disabilities
article: Social welfare minister Raaj Kumar Anand on Friday visited health camps at Bhagwan Mahavir Hospital, Rani Bagh, Pitampura in Northwest Delhi.

title: Stop issuing fake disability certificates: Court to govt

276 fined for illegal travel in disabled coaches: CR
PIL claims disabilities not included in health survey
article: The high court has ordered notice to various authorities under the central government in a public interest litigation (PIL) complaining against non-inclusion of disabilities in a household study under National Family Health Survey-6 (NFHS-6).​

title: New OPDs get disabled-friendly

Missing disabled girl found dead
Here's why Google Maps has disabled live traffic conditions in Israel and Gaza
article: Google is disabling live traffic conditions in Israel and the Gaza Strip in response to a request from the Israeli military. This move is aimed at ensuring the safety of local communities amid the ongoing conflict in the region. The company had previously taken similar actions in Ukraine after Russia's invasion. Apple's Maps app has also complied with the Israeli army's request. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Deputy Treasury Secretary Wally Adeyemo are both involved in diplomatic efforts related to the Middle East conflict.

title: Beating all odds: disability fails to douse spirit of this school headmaster in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore district

Land allotment for the disabled: Govt officials get contempt warning
article: Observing that it was the “most shameful state of affairs”, a Bombay high court division bench of Justices Gautam Patel and Neela Gokhale lamented the “failure of the [state] government to furnish a meaningful response” to its query over steps taken for 5% land allotment reservation to persons with disabilities.

title: Rights body seeks report on vasectomy ‘without consent’
Rihanna makes 'huge' donation to disabled, homeless veterans in Los Angeles
article: Singer Rihanna recently made a huge donation including hygiene kits, socks, clothes, sleeping bags, food, toilet paper, and dog food to the disabled and homeless veterans in Los Angeles. The ace singer has always been vocal about pressing social and political issues and for this, she has often attracted controversies.

Special schools to be transformed under 5T initiative
article: The department of social security and empowerment of persons with disabilities, in collaboration with the department of school and mass education, has decided to transform all the existing special schools in the state with quality infrastructure under 5T initiative.
